actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 788.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 788 — "To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue fully electronic stamps under that Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2839.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2839 — "To amend the Siletz Reservation Act to address the hunting, fishing, trapping, and animal gathering rights of the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2747.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2747 — "To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to extend the Administrative Fine Program for certain reporting violations."

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 7, 2023, at 3:37 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3250. Appointment: Member of the Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys and Member of the Commission on Reforem and Modernization of the Department of State.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3315.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Moran moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3315 — "To exempt for an additional 4-year period, from the application of the means-test presumption of abuse under chapter 7, qualifying members of reserve components of the Armed Forces and members of the National Guard who, after September 11, 2001, are called to active duty or to perform a homeland defense activity for not less than 90 days."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Moran to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rear Admiral Gregory Todd, Chief of Chaplains, United States Navy, Washington, DC
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Derrick Van Orden to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
